intro: Ruschia middlemostii, commonly known as the Middlemost's Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
